title: Grievous Wounds

As a tank main, the new change to IE that will convert a % of crits to true damage annoys me.  Not because it means that they will deal more damage to me, but because it takes away how I can counter build, and it makes it so that crit carries dont have to itemize into armor pen any more.

The funniest thing was to watch as a fed ADC in the mid game with IE and double zeal auto'd a tank and was dealing just about no damage, then they go to allchat and bitch about how tanks are OP and even when they have 3 damage items they can't hurt them.  Motherfucker, I'm sitting on 3 armor items for about 250+ armor, plus a defensive steroid.  You haven't spent the 1300 gold on an armor pen item yet.  Of course you deal no damage.
HP is the counter build to true damage.

Hp scales at unit returns, AD is attached to a quintic scaling damage formula, literally four powers higher of a function.  Not orders of magnitude, but legit powers. 

HP does not counter damage in any way shape nor form.  Damage hard counters defense (hp + resists) and true damage is even harder of a counter by ignoring resistances completely, turning the quadratic defensive formula into a linear one.

A linear function can never compete with a 5th power function.

Do you even know what those words mean? You sound like you just rambled out some stuff at random.

What you are saying is that reaching 0 hp doesn't kill you.

Uh, let's see, he correctly points out that auto attacks scale off a fifth power function (at least with respect to attack damage, as the damage from AS, crit chance, armor pen, and crit damage/IE's true damage on crit all scale with attack damage, so if you include the interaction terms, you end up with a formula that contains an 'AD^5' term as the highest power term.  This makes the damage formula a fifth power, or 'quintic' function)

He then notes that this is different from orders of magnitude, but is in fact a difference in the powers of the respective damage and resistance formulas.  The formula for resistance to true damage is literally just 1.0(HP), or a 1st power function of X where X is their total hp.  This is also known more simply as a linear function.

He also contrasts this linear function for resistances to true damage to the resistance formula for physical/magic damage wherein you only take 100/(100+armor)[incoming physical damage] or conversely where your pEHP can be depicted as hp(1 + armor/100).  Since this is effectively 1.0 hp + 1% hp per 1 point of armor, its a quadratic formula with respect to hp.

Are there any other words or parts of his comment that don't make sense?  I assure you not a single word was used incorrectly, and the strawman at the end of your comment has nothing to do with the comment you replied to.
That's not how powers work. Also it's not how true damage works.

And for the counter argument f(x) = 1^5 will never outscale anything, and it is a 5th degree polynomial.

f(x) = 1 + 0x^2 + 0x^3 + 0X^4 + 0X^5

That would actually be a 0th degree polynomial. . . you don't maths do you? 

That literally simplifies to f(x) = 1

That's not even a function, that's the constant 1.  It's not even a polynomial, and you wouldn't denote it by any power or function of f, but just as C where C = 1.
Look up the definition of identity. I happen to have a degree in math so I actually do know what I'm talking about.

Well, armor stacking tanks force you to pay a 1300 gold Tax xD but you have to remember that IE true damage is still after damage reductions, so the true damage scales of the damage dealt by the actual attack. a 1k crit->reduced to 500 damage->true damage is also based on the 500 damage

grievious wounds should be removed all together. If you are going to tie counterplay to an item, not everyone can build #Bruisers with last whisper, or not everyone can rush especially after mage changes that need mana, you are going to have problem. Remove grievious wounds and balance champions afterwards.

The champs identity are tied around being strong healers or drain tanks.  Itemization and GW are there so you have access to counterplay.  There are 3 items that give GW.  {{item:3123}} is 800g and is there for AD champs, especially ADCs.  800g to reduce the enemies heals by 40%.  {{item:3076}} exists for tanks/juggs/bruisers.  Again, 1000g, you can pick it up and sit on it for the GW.

{{item:3165}} is the only completed it that doesnt build out of an item that gives GW.  Which sucks for mages, especially since many of them want to go early mana regen items. {{item:3003}} {{item:3027}} {{item:3285}} But they still have access to it and if the enemy team consists of multiple healer champs or one of those is fed, you postpone your build to pick up the GW.

And what would be the difference, if grievious wounds were removed all together? You would have much easier time balancing champions that utilize healing and life steal, create much smaller difference between high elo and low elo. The biggest reason why darius vladimir mundo soraka etcetera are so freaking nightmarish in plat elo and below is that noone wants to build grievious wounds. You either balance these champs for high elo, make them unbearable in low elo, or you balance them around low elo and make them non existent in high elo. Why not just get rid of it completely and make countering those champions more about outplaying them rather than outbuying?

{{item:3076}} Does not do much against ability based healing as the opponent can just choose not to attack you ({{champion:154}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:50}})

And with how cheap GW is (at least for AD and tank champions) most healing needs to be balanced around the fact that it will likely be reduced by grevious wounds.... so then that leads to the issue that at that point you might as well lower the healing amount and remove grevious wounds

Grievious isn't really needed against Olaf.

Olaf generally builds literally full tank, in which case his W sustain is.. pretty neglible, even when he gets to just sit there knocking on a squishy target for entire duration without them ranging him.

When built more bruisery, Olaf's super easy to kill **unless he's insanely head**.

Vlad and Mundo definitely though.
